comments:
HI 

I have an RCP build in Eclipse 3.1 Stable Build but i was shifting to Eclipse 
3.2 and when i run my Product after my Splash screen i get Widget disposed too 
early ! 

I also tried running my plugins as part of Eclipse and realised that its not 
able to initialise the perspective but am able to open my views. Would be glad 
if someone can look into this. 

I need to move to Eclipse 3.2 for TreeColumn drag and drop option. Or can you 
tell me if this can be achieved by just replacing the SWT Plugin from 3.2 to 
3.1.

properties -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2005-10-05 10:26:22.318
!MESSAGE java.lang.ClassCastException
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartStack.showPart(PartStack.java:1286)

(PerspectiveHelper.java:230)

	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.onActivate
(WorkbenchPage.java:2209)

What pages are you trying to open?  Could you debug your RCP app and find out
what is the class of the object that is getting the class cast exception in
PartStack.

Thanx,
PW

I traced the complete RCP Code. The problem lies in the PerspectiveExtension 
extension point. I had set something relative to org.eclipse.ui.editorss and in 
stack position. It was working in Eclipse 3.1 but seems to crash in Eclipse 3.2 
M2 but i have got the solution. I have set it right. Thank you. 

the problem was when it tries to place the given view stacked with 
org.eclipse.ui.editorss it through some classCastException in 
partStack.showControl().
